articles.title: COVID-19 Guidelines
articles.contents:
Guidelines from University:
In accordance with university policy, you are required to wear a mask upon entering the building. Masks will need to stay on during class.
Follow detailed guideline from university website
Guidelines for ECIV 340L class:
The ECIV 340L course is taught face-to-face and the students work in group. Thus, the students are encouraged to adhere to these guidelines:
Use FACE MASKS when in the building and while working in a group. Face Masks (one-time use) can be provided upon request or they might be placed in-class.
Use hand gloves when using the lab equipment, HAND GLOVES will be provided in each class by the instructor
Maintain social distancing while interaction with other students/instructors, as much as possible

articles.title: Transportation Engineering Laboratory
articles.description:
ECIV 340L   
Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering    
University of South Carolina
articles.contents:
body {
text-align: justify}
Course Description
This course aims to provide students with sound data collection and analysis techniques. This course is intended to complement the materials covered in Introduction to Transportation Engineering (ECIV 340), with emphasis on field experience.
Learning Outcomes
At the conclusion of this course, students should be able to:
Collect necessary traffic data to support traffic impact studies and transportation planning studies.
Make field book entry and perform engineering calculations in proper format using self-measured data.
Write engineering reports.
Prerequisites/Co-Requisites
Students must either have previously completed ECIV 340 or take ECIV 340 in the same semester as this course (ECIV 340L). Students are expected to be proficient with Microsoft Excel. The prerequisite for the class are ECIV 101 and STAT 509.
Useful References
1. “Introduction to Traffic Engineering: A Manual for data Collection and Analysis” 2nd edition by Thomas R. Currin. Cengage Learning, 2013.
“Elementary Surveying: An Introduction to Geomatics” 14th edition by Charles D. Ghilani and Paul R. Wolf. Prentice Hall, 2015.
